required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Utilization Study for Pirinase Hayfever Relief
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Utilization Study for Pirinase Hayfever Relief for Adults 0.05% Nasal Spray

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose is to obtain real-world information on how consumers are complying with the product labelling This study will coincide with the launch of Pirinase Hayfever Relief for Adults 0.05% Nasal Spray in the United Kingdom (UK).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of consumers with 18 years of age or older
Number of consumers with use of not more than 2 sprays/nostril per day
Number of consumers with reduced dose of 1 spray/nostril per day if symptoms improve
Number of consumers who consulted Doctor before use in pregnant or breastfeeding woman
Number of consumers who consulted Doctor if symptoms do not improve after 7 days of use

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of consumers taking HIV medications do not use the drug
Number of consumers who consulted doctor if medication is used more than 1 month continuously

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pirinase Hayfever Relief for Adults 0.05% Nasal Spray
arm_group.description: Two sprays into each nostril once a day, preferably in the morning. Once symptoms are under control ,a maintenance dose of one spray may be used accordingly

intervention.intervention_name: Pirinase Hayfever Relief for Adults 0.05% Nasal Spray
intervention.description: Aqueous suspension of 0.05% micronised fluticasone propionate.Each actuation contains 50 micrograms of fluticasone propionate
intervention.arm_group_label: Pirinase Hayfever Relief for Adults 0.05% Nasal Spray

study_pop.textblock: An all comers population (consumers who opt in at their own discretion) of approximately 1,537 consumers, will be included in this study. Age, gender, and social backgrounds will be allowed to fall out naturally.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants will be required to review, and electronically sign a Participation Agreement prior to completing the online survey.
- Participants of any age may participate.
- Participants who have purchased and used Pirinase Hayfever Relief for Adults 0.05% Nasal Spray for at least 7 days and are willing to participate in the online survey.
- Participants of either gender may participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anyone who is directly involved with medicines such as doctors, nurses, and pharmacists.
- Participants who decline participation in the online survey
